node.title: Is petrol in Canberra too cheap? Price data suggests it might be
node.description: Fuel prices in the ACT are usually higher than in Sydney, but that norm has been up-ended over the past year.
node.content:
["Fuel prices hit \"historic highs\" this month, both in Canberra and across the country.", "ACT motorists paid, on average,\u00a0$1.72 per litre of unleaded petrol last week.", "But the big news is not how much Canberrans are paying for fuel \u2014 it's how little we've been paying.", "For most of the past year, the average weekly price of unleaded petrol has been cheaper in the ACT than in Sydney.", "In fact, the\u00a0typical Canberra motorist, driving a car of average fuel economy\u00a0over the average (pandemic) mileage, would have spent $94 less on petrol than their Sydney counterpart over the past year.", "
ACT drivers usually pay a premium
", "Cheap \u2014 or relatively cheap \u2014 petrol in Canberra is not the norm: prices in the ACT are usually higher than in most cities.", "The market watchdog, the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission, has previously explained some of the reasons for this.", "For example, Canberra has fewer independent fuel retailers and less competition than bigger cities.", "It's further from refineries, too, which adds marginally to freight costs.", "The ACT is also relatively affluent \u2014 and goods\u00a0and services tend to cost more in places with higher incomes. (This explains in part why Canberra's childcare and GP fees are the nation's highest.)", "Nonetheless,\u00a0the premium that Canberrans usually pay for petrol became a crisis 18 months ago, when the gap between\u00a0Sydney and ACT prices regularly exceeded 20 cents a litre.", "Chief Minister Andrew Barr even threatened to impose statutory caps on service stations'\u00a0retail margins\u00a0\u2014 the difference\u00a0between the wholesale and pump price.", "\"We know we're being gouged and it has got to stop,\" Mr Barr said.", "\"We have a market failure that necessitates government intervention.\"", "Station owners responded, prices fell and the crisis passed \u2014 without the government fiddling\u00a0with the market.", "
We notice price rises, but forget the falls
", "", "
Petrol prices are constantly in sight, unlike most other commodity prices.(ABC News: Nick Haggarty)
", "So, given that Canberra usually has higher petrol prices \u2014 and with reason \u2014 what happened over the past year?", "The likely explanation is that demand for fuel in the ACT, and hence its price, collapsed because Canberrans stopped driving \u2014 more so than other Australians.", "More workers in Canberra were able to work from home\u00a0and chose to do so, not only during lockdowns but throughout the pandemic.", "In other words, the ACT petrol market \u2014 supply, demand and pricing \u2014 seems to be working as a free market should work.", "Australian National University energy economist Paul Burke says petrol prices attract more political attention than other commodity prices simply because they are visible.", "\"Petrol price signs are so huge and we drive past them frequently, so they're at the top of our mind,\" he says.", "\"They are much more up-front compared to some other charges that we pay \u2014 for example, related to our superannuation accounts \u2014 that we might rarely check.\"", "
Today's 'historic highs' are not very high
", "Motorists organisation NRMA has called this month's pump prices record-breaking and\u00a0\"the worst we've ever seen\".", "Strictly speaking, this is true \u2014 but only if one ignores inflation.", "The real fuel price, factoring in our\u00a0capacity to pay, is high, but nowhere near record-breaking.", "This is partly why Dr Burke says Mr Barr's threat to cap ACT petrol prices last year was \"an intervention searching for a problem\".", "\"It would be better to be focusing them on things that will help us reduce our emissions, rather than pushing down the price of petrol,\" he says.", "Indeed, beyond the price movements linked to global oil supplies, Australia's petrol prices have always been at the lower end of the international market.", "Very few developed countries \u2014 the United States being a stand-out exception \u2014 have cheaper fuel, largely thanks to Australia's tiny taxes.", "Dr Burke says this is likely slowing down Australians' transition to electric-powered vehicles (EVs).", "\"One of the key determinants of whether countries have very fuel-efficient fleets is how high their petrol prices are,\" he says.", "He recommends that governments increase fuel excises, to help break the dependence on petrol.", "\"Over the long run, it's going to be a dying source of revenue as we shift to electric vehicles,\" he says.", "\"But a higher rate\u00a0[of fuel excise] would encourage us to shift to EVs, and the revenue we collect in the interim could be used for things such as public transport investment.\"", "", "
Electric vehicles are far cheaper to run but their price is a hurdle.(ABC News: Chris Taylor)
", "
Canberra needs a real-time price-monitoring network
", "NRMA\u00a0spokesman Peter Khoury agrees that governments should do more to encourage EV use, such as rolling out more chargers and helping to reduce the vehicles' prices.", "However, the NRMA says that should not be paid for by punishing drivers with higher taxes.", "Mr Khoury says Canberra motorists are at a particular disadvantage because the ACT government has not set up a real-time, petrol-price-monitoring network.", "Every other jurisdiction has, except Victoria.", "\"It would just [make it] a little easier for motorists for find cheaper petrol stations,\" Mr Khoury says.", "\"At the moment Canberrans are driving blind: they have no idea whether they're getting a good price or not.\""]
